intro: Halenia vincetoxicoides, commonly known as the poison ivy vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant contains toxic compounds, particularly in its sap, which can cause dermatitis in humans. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically greenish-yellow in color. The fruit is a capsule that releases seeds when mature, aiding in its propagation.
